thread.title: VIDEO: Dez Bryant says last-place Cowboys will still 'run the East'
thread.title_full: VIDEO: Dez Bryant says last-place Cowboys will still 'run the East' - CBSSports.com

author: John Breech
title: VIDEO: Dez Bryant says last-place Cowboys will still 'run the East'
text:
The Cowboys haven't won a game since Tony Romo went down with a broken collarbone in Week 2. Including Sunday's 27-20 loss to the Giants, the Cowboys have now lost four in a row and sit in dead last of the NFC East. 
None of that seems to bother Dez Bryant , though.
As the Cowboys wide receiver was walking off the field at MetLife Stadium on Sunday, he told Giants fans that the Cowboys are "still gonna run the East" this year.
#Cowboys @DezBryant leaves the field with a promise - "We still gon' run the East!" #WFAACowboys #NFL pic.twitter.com/5u5gyo2IiT 
â€” Mike Leslie (@MikeLeslieWFAA) October 25, 2015 Considering that the Cowboys (2-4) are stuck with either Brandon Weeden or Matt Cassel for at least the next three weeks, that's a lot of confidence coming from Bryant. 
Romo isn't expected to return until Week 11, which means the Cowboys will have to play the Seahawks and the Eagles in the next two weeks without him.
Even if Bryant gets back on the field for next Sunday's game against Seattle, beating the Seahawks with Cassel (or Weeden) under center is going to be almost impossible. 
The Cowboys also still have to play the Packers and Panthers. Basically, winning the NFC East is getting closer and closer to being out of the question. Dez might want to start focusing on getting a wild card berth. Dez Bryant is pretty confident about the rest of the season. (Twitter) Topics: Brandon Weeden , Dez Bryant , Matt Cassel , Dallas Cowboys , NFL
